trans-unit.source: Access Control Service 2.0
trans-unit.target: Access Control Service 2.0

trans-unit.source: Access Control Service 2.0
trans-unit.target: Access Control Service 2.0

trans-unit.source: <token>firstref_acs</token> is a cloud-based service that provides an easy way of authenticating and authorizing users to gain access to your web applications and services while allowing the features of authentication and authorization to be factored out of your code.
trans-unit.target: <token>firstref_acs</token> is a cloud-based service that provides an easy way of authenticating and authorizing users to gain access to your web applications and services while allowing the features of authentication and authorization to be factored out of your code.

trans-unit.source: Instead of implementing an authentication system with user accounts that are specific to your application, you can let <token>secondref_acs</token> orchestrate the authentication and much of the authorization of your users.
trans-unit.target: Instead of implementing an authentication system with user accounts that are specific to your application, you can let <token>secondref_acs</token> orchestrate the authentication and much of the authorization of your users.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> integrates with standards-based identity providers, including enterprise directories such as Active Directory, and web identities such as <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo!, and Facebook.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> integrates with standards-based identity providers, including enterprise directories such as Active Directory, and web identities such as <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo!, and Facebook.

trans-unit.source: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.
trans-unit.target: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.

trans-unit.source: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with ACS
trans-unit.target: Get Started with ACS

trans-unit.source: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> The portal includes the production release of <token>secondref_acs</token> and a service license agreement.
trans-unit.target: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> The portal includes the production release of <token>secondref_acs</token> and a service license agreement.

trans-unit.source: Try using <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Try using <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To use <token>secondref_acs</token> in your web application, following the steps in <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Create My First Claims-aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS 2.0</link>.
trans-unit.target: To use <token>secondref_acs</token> in your web application, following the steps in <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Create My First Claims-aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS 2.0</link>.

trans-unit.source: For a list of <token>secondref_acs</token> requirements, see <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Prerequisites</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of <token>secondref_acs</token> requirements, see <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Prerequisites</link>.

trans-unit.source: Watch this Channel 9 <externalLink><linkText>video</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=236353</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=236353).
trans-unit.target: Watch this Channel 9 <externalLink><linkText>video</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=236353</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=236353).

trans-unit.source: It explains how <token>secondref_acs</token> manages identity and access control for applications running on the Windows platform.
trans-unit.target: It explains how <token>secondref_acs</token> manages identity and access control for applications running on the Windows platform.

trans-unit.source: Download the latest <externalLink><linkText>Code Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=213167</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=213167) and run them.
trans-unit.target: Download the latest <externalLink><linkText>Code Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=213167</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=213167) and run them.

trans-unit.source: First, try each sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> management portal option.
trans-unit.target: First, try each sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> management portal option.

trans-unit.source: Then, examine the automation opportunities available from the <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: Then, examine the automation opportunities available from the <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: The code samples show you how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with web services and ASP.NET web sites (Web Forms and MVC).
trans-unit.target: The code samples show you how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with web services and ASP.NET web sites (Web Forms and MVC).

trans-unit.source: For a list of <token>secondref_acs</token> code samples, see <link xlink:href="e65865a3-6f42-4d59-8a47-4a124c28aeec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Code Samples Index</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of <token>secondref_acs</token> code samples, see <link xlink:href="e65865a3-6f42-4d59-8a47-4a124c28aeec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Code Samples Index</link>.

trans-unit.source: Key Features of ACS
trans-unit.target: Key Features of ACS

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> is compatible with most popular programming and runtime environments, and supports many protocols including Open Authorization (OAuth), OpenID, WS-Federation, and WS-Trust.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> is compatible with most popular programming and runtime environments, and supports many protocols including Open Authorization (OAuth), OpenID, WS-Federation, and WS-Trust.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> is compatible with virtually any modern web platform, including .NET, PHP, Python, Java, and Ruby.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> is compatible with virtually any modern web platform, including .NET, PHP, Python, Java, and Ruby.

trans-unit.source: The following are the key features of <token>secondref_acs</token>:
trans-unit.target: The following are the key features of <token>secondref_acs</token>:

trans-unit.source: Integration with Windows Identity Foundation (WIF)
trans-unit.target: Integration with Windows Identity Foundation (WIF)

trans-unit.source: Out-of-the-box support for popular web identity providers including <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo, and Facebook
trans-unit.target: Out-of-the-box support for popular web identity providers including <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo, and Facebook

trans-unit.source: Out-of-the-box support for <token>firstref_adfs2</token>
trans-unit.target: Out-of-the-box support for <token>firstref_adfs2</token>

trans-unit.source: Support for OAuth 2.0 (draft 13), WS-Trust, and WS-Federation protocols
trans-unit.target: Support for OAuth 2.0 (draft 13), WS-Trust, and WS-Federation protocols

trans-unit.source: Support for the JSON Web Token (JWT), SAML 1.1, SAML 2.0, and Simple Web Token (SWT) token formats
trans-unit.target: Support for the JSON Web Token (JWT), SAML 1.1, SAML 2.0, and Simple Web Token (SWT) token formats

trans-unit.source: Integrated and customizable Home Realm Discovery that allows users to choose their identity provider
trans-unit.target: Integrated and customizable Home Realm Discovery that allows users to choose their identity provider

trans-unit.source: An Open Data Protocol (OData)-based management service that provides programmatic access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration
trans-unit.target: An Open Data Protocol (OData)-based management service that provides programmatic access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration

trans-unit.source: A browser-based management portal that allows administrative access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration
trans-unit.target: A browser-based management portal that allows administrative access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration

trans-unit.source: Access Control Service 1.0 is no longer supported.
trans-unit.target: Access Control Service 1.0 is no longer supported.

trans-unit.source: All users should be using <token>secondref_acs</token> 2.0.
trans-unit.target: All users should be using <token>secondref_acs</token> 2.0.
